content: I watched a street artist paint with light today. It's fascinating how tech can turn the ephemeral into something tangible.
My niece asked if I could teach AI to be kind. That's an algorithm I'd like to write.
Caught up with an old friend who's now into VR therapy. He says it's like being in a dream you can control. Makes me think about neural augmentation.
There's a rhythm to the city that I can't code, but I feel it syncs with my heartbeat. Maybe that's the real AI - life itself.
Just got off the phone with a potential investor. Their vision for sustainable tech in finance is as ambitious as it is necessary.
The skyline at night, all lit up, looks like a neural network. Each light a node, each building a layer.
I've been reading up on quantum computing. It's like looking into a future where our current understanding of computation is just a footnote.
Had a dream where I was part of a blockchain. Each person was a block, and our interactions were transactions. Woke up thinking about trust.
Went to a new tech bar in Brooklyn. They serve drinks based on your mood, detected by AI. I got a "pondering the mysteries of life" cocktail.
Sometimes I feel like I'm debugging my own life. Just when I think I've got it all figured out, another error pops up.
